info.name: Meraki Dashboard Prov API
info.description:
# Meraki Dashboard API

This collection of API calls provides an easy way to interact with a Cisco Meraki network. Update your environment variables to efficiently use the collection.

**Common Variables**
* X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key
* organizationId
* networkId

You will need to add additional variables as the endpoints require more details, such as a **serial** or **ssid**.


# What's New?

** Oct 2017. **
- Group Policy support
	* Bind a client to a Group Policy
	* List Group Policies for a Network
- MX L3 Firewalls
	* Return L3 Firewall Rules
	* Update L3 Firewall Rules
- Bluetooth Settings
	* Return Bluetooth Settings
	* Update Bluetooth Settings


## Documentation and Resources

http://developers.meraki.com/

## Troubleshooting:
- Check your profile permissions. If you can't do it in Dashboard, you won't be able to in the API.

- Some calls seem to work better if you use the shard number instead of "dashboard" because of a required redirect. Just update the shard that matches when you login to the web Dashboard. It will be in the URL.

**Original**

```
- https://dashboard.meraki.com/api/v0/networks/{{networkId}}/ssids/{{ssidNum}}?name=viaAPI345&number={{ssidNum}}
```
**With shard number**

```
- https://n123.meraki.com/api/v0/networks/{{networkId}}/ssids/{{ssidNum}}?name=viaAPI345&number={{ssidNum}}
```

request.description:
## HTTP REQUEST
```
GET /organizations/[organization_id]/admins
```

## PARAMETERS
**None**

## SAMPLE REQUEST
```
curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -X GET -H 'Content-Type: application/json' 'https://dashboard.meraki.com/api/v0/organizations/1234/admins'
```
## SAMPLE RESPONSE
```
Successful HTTP Status: 200
[
  {
    "id":"1",
    "name":"Miles Meraki",
    "email":"miles@meraki.com",
    "orgAccess":"none",
    "tags":[
      {
        "tag":"west",
        "access":"read-only"
      }
    ],
    "networks":[
      {
        "id":"N_249",
        "access":"full"
      }
    ]
  }
]
```

item.name: Admins - Create a new dashboard administrator
Admins - Revoke all access for a dashboard administrator for this org
Clients - List the clients of a device, up to 1 month
Clients - Return the group policy that is assigned to a device in the network

request.description:
```
HTTP REQUEST
GET /networks/[networkId]/clients/[client_mac]/policy
PARAMETERS
timespan
The timespan for which clients will be fetched. Must be in seconds and less than or equal to a month (2592000 seconds).
SAMPLE REQUEST
curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -X GET -H 'Content-Type: application/json' 'https://dashboard.meraki.com/api/v0/networks/[networkId]/clients/[mac]/policy?timespan=86400'
SAMPLE RESPONSE
Successful HTTP Status: 200
{
  "mac": "00:11:22:33:44:55",
  "type": "Group policy",
  "groupPolicyId": 101
}
```

item.name: Clients - Update the group policy assigned to a device in the network

request.description:
```
HTTP REQUEST
PUT /networks/[id]/clients/[mac]/policy
PARAMETERS
devicePolicy
The group policy (Whitelisted, Blocked, Normal, Group policy)
groupPolicyId
[optional] If devicePolicy param is set to 'group' this param is used to specify the group id.
SAMPLE REQUEST
curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -X PUT -H 'Content-Type: application/json' 'https://dashboard.meraki.com/api/v0/networks/[id]/clients/[mac]/policy'
SAMPLE RESPONSE
Successful HTTP Status: 200
{
  "mac": "00:11:22:33:44:55",
  "type": "Group policy",
  "groupPolicyId": 101
}
```

item.name: Clients - Return the splash authorization for a client, for each SSID they've associated with through splash.
Clients - Update a client's splash authorization

request.description:
## HTTP REQUEST
```
PUT /networks/[id]/clients/[mac]/splashAuthorizationStatus
```

## PARAMETERS

**ssids**

The target SSIDs. For each SSID where isAuthorized is true, the expiration time will automatically be set according to the SSID's splash frequency.

**isAuthorized**

New authorization status for SSID (true, false).

## SAMPLE REQUEST
```
curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -X PUT -H 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-binary '{"ssids":{"0":{"isAuthorized":true},"2":{"isAuthorized":false}}}' 'https://dashboard.meraki.com/api/v0/networks/[id]/clients/[mac]/splashAuthorizationStatus'
```

## SAMPLE RESPONSE
```
Successful HTTP Status: 200
{
  "ssids": {
    "0": {
      "isAuthorized": true,
      "authorizedAt": "2017-07-19 16:24:13 UTC",
      "expiresAt": "2017-07-20 16:24:13 UTC"
    },
    "2": {
      "isAuthorized": false
    }
  }
}
```

response.name: Clients - Update a client's splash authorization

item.name: Config Templates - List the config templates for this org
Config Templates - Remove a configuration template

request.description:
```
HTTP REQUEST
GET /networks/[id]/groupPolicies
PARAMETERS
None
SAMPLE REQUEST
curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -X GET -H 'Content-Type: application/json' 'https://dashboard.meraki.com/api/v0/networks/[id]/groupPolicies'
SAMPLE RESPONSE
Successful HTTP Status: 200
[
  {
    "name": "No video streaming",
    "groupPolicyId": 102
  }
  ...
]
```

item.name: L3 Firewall Rules for an SSID
L3 Firewall Rules Update an SSID

request.description:
## HTTP REQUEST
```GET /networks/[networkId]/l3FirewallRules```
## PARAMETERS
None


## SAMPLE REQUEST
```
curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -X GET -H 'Content-Type: application/json' 'https://dashboard.meraki.com/api/v0/networks/[networkId]/l3FirewallRules'
```

## SAMPLE RESPONSE
```
Successful HTTP Status: 200
[
  {
     "comment": "Allow tcp traffic to subnet with http servers.",
     "policy": "allow",
     "protocol": "tcp",
     "destPort": "80,443",
     "destCidr": "10.1.333/24",
     "srcPort": "Any",
     "srcCidr": "Any",
     "syslogEnabled": false
  },
  {
     "comment": "Block all tcp to http/https ports.",
     "policy": "deny",
     "protocol": "http",
     "destPort": "80,443",
     "destCidr": "10.1.1.0/24,10.1.2.0/24",
     "srcPort": "Any",
     "srcCidr": "Any",
     "syslogEnabled": false
  },
  {
     "comment": "Default rule",
     "policy": "allow",
     "protocol": "Any",
     "destPort": "Any",
     "destCidr": "Any",
     "srcPort": "Any",
     "srcCidr": "Any",
     "syslogEnabled": false
  }
]
```

## HTTP REQUEST
```
PUT /networks/[networkId]/l3FirewallRules
```

## PARAMETERS
**rules**

An ordered array of the firewall rules (not including the default rule)

**comment**|**Description of the rule (optional)**
:-----:|:-----:
policy|Allow' or 'Deny' traffic specified by this rule
protocol|The type of protocol (must be 'tcp', 'udp', 'icmp' or 'any')
srcPort|Comma-separated list of source port(s) (integer in the range 1-65535), or 'any'
srcCidr|Comma-separated list of source IP address(es) (in IP or CIDR notation), or 'any' (note: FQDN not supported for source addresses)
destPort|Comma-separated list of destination port(s) (integer in the range 1-65535), or 'any'
destCidr|Comma-separated list of destination IP address(es) (in IP or CIDR notation), fully-qualified domain names (FQDN) or 'any'
syslogEnabled|Log this rule to syslog (true or false, boolean value) - only applicable if a syslog has been configured (optional)


**syslogDefaultRule**

Log the special default rule (boolean value - enable only if you've configured a syslog server) (optional)

### SAMPLE RESPONSE
```
Successful HTTP Status: 200
[
  {
     "comment": "a note about the rule",
     "policy": "deny",
     "protocol": "tcp",
     "destPort": "80,443",
     "destCidr": "192.168.1.0/24,192.168.2.0/24",
     "srcPort": "Any",
     "srcCidr": "Any",
     "syslogEnabled": true
  },
  {
     "comment": "Default rule",
     "policy": "allow",
     "protocol": "Any",
     "destPort": "Any",
     "destCidr": "Any",
     "srcPort": "Any",
     "srcCidr": "Any",
     "syslogEnabled": true
  }
]
```

request.description:
## HTTP REQUEST
```
GET /networks/[id]/bluetoothSettings
```
## PARAMETERS
**none**

## SAMPLE REQUEST
```
curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -X GET -H 'Content-Type: application/json' 'https://dashboard.meraki.com/api/v0/networks/[id]/bluetoothSettings'
```
## SAMPLE RESPONSE
```
Successful HTTP Status: 200
{
  "id":"N_1234",
  "scanningEnabled": true,
  "advertisingEnabled": true,
  "uuid": "00000000-0000-0000-000-000000000000"
  "majorMinorAssignmentMode": "Non-unique"
  "major": 65535,
  "minor": 65535,
}
```

## HTTP REQUEST
```
PUT /networks/[id]/bluetoothSettings
```
## PARAMETERS

scanningEnabled|Whether APs will scan for Bluetooth enabled clients. (true, false)
-----|-----
advertisingEnabled|Whether APs will advertise beacons. (true, false)
uuid|The UUID to be used in the beacon identifier.
majorMinorAssignmentMode|The way major and minor number should be assigned to nodes in the network. ('Unique', 'Non-unique')
major|The major number to be used in the beacon identifier. Only valid in 'Non-unique' mode.
minor|The minor number to be used in the beacon identifier. Only valid in 'Non-unique' mode.

## SAMPLE REQUEST
```
curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -X PUT -H 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-binary '{"scanningEnabled":true, "advertisingEnabled":true, "uuid":"00000000-0000-0000-000-000000000000", "majorMinorAssignmentMode":"Unique"}' 'https://dashboard.meraki.com/api/v0/networks/N_1234/bluetoothSettings'
```

## SAMPLE RESPONSE
```
Successful HTTP Status: 200
{
  "id":"N_1234",
  "scanningEnabled": true,
  "advertisingEnabled": true,
  "uuid": "00000000-0000-0000-000-000000000000"
  "majorMinorAssignmentMode": "Unique"
  "major": 1,
}
```

item.name: List Air Marshal scan results from a network
Organizations - List organizations this user has access to
Organizations - Create new org by cloning
Organizations - Claim order, license key, or order into an organization

request.description:
## HTTP REQUEST
```
PUT /organizations/[id]/snmp
```
## PARAMETERS
name|info
----|----
v2cEnabled|Boolean indicating whether SNMP version 2c is enabled for the organization|v3Enabled
Boolean| indicating whether SNMP version 3 is enabled for the organization
v3AuthMode|The SNMP version 3 authentication mode either MD5 or SHA
v3AuthPass|The SNMP version 3 authentication password. Must be at least 8 characters if specified.
v3PrivMode|The SNMP version 3 privacy mode DES or AES128
v3PrivPass|The SNMP version 3 privacy password. Must be at least 8 characters if specified.
peerIps|The IPs that are allowed to access the SNMP server. This list should be IPv4 addresses separated by semi-colons (ie. "1.2.3.4;2.3.4.5").

## SAMPLE REQUEST
```
curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -X PUT -H 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-binary '{"v2cEnabled":true,"v3Enabled":false}' 'https://dashboard.meraki.com/api/v0/organizations/[id]/snmp'
```

## SAMPLE RESPONSE
```
Successful HTTP Status: 200
{
  "v2cEnabled":false,
  "v3Enabled":false,
  "v3AuthMode":null,
  "v3PrivMode":null,
  "hostname":"n1.meraki.com",
  "port":16100,
  "peerIps":null
}
```

item.name: Organizations - Return the third party VPN peers
Organizations - Update the third party VPN peers
Phone contacts - List the phone contacts in a network
Phone contacts - Add a phone contact
Phone contacts - Update a phone contact
Phone contacts - Delete a phone contact
Phone numbers - List all the phone numbers in a network
Phone numbers - List the available phone numbers in a network
SAML roles - List the SAML roles for this organization
SAML roles - Return a SAML role
SAML roles - Update a SAML role
SAML roles - Create a SAML role
SAML roles - Remove a SAML role
SM - List the devices enrolled in an SM network with various specified fields and filters
SM - Add, delete, or update the tags of a set of devices
*SM - Modify the fields of a device
SM - Force check-in a set of devices

request.description:
HTTP REQUEST
PUT /networks/[network_id]/sm/devices/checkin
PARAMETERS
wifiMacs
The wifiMacs of the devices to be checked-in.
ids
The ids of the devices to be checked-in.
serials
The serials of the devices to be checked-in.
scope
The scope (one of withAny, withAll, withoutAny, or withoutAll) and a set of tags of the devices to be checked-in.

item.name: SM - Move a set of devices to a new network

request.description:
HTTP REQUEST
PUT /networks/[network_id]/sm/devices/move
PARAMETERS
wifiMacs
The wifiMacs of the devices to be moved.
ids
The ids of the devices to be moved.
serials
The serials of the devices to be moved.
scope
The scope (one of withAny, withAll, withoutAny, or withoutAll) and a set of tags of the devices to be moved.
newNetwork
The new network to which the devices will be moved.

item.name: VLANs - List the VLANs for this network
